title: PHPis_dir()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPis_dir()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Check whether the specified filename is a directory:
<?php
$file = "images";
if(is_dir($file)) {
echo ("$file is a directory");
}
else {
echo ("$file is not a directory");
}
?>
The output of the code above could be:
images is a directory
Definition and Usage
The is_dir() function checks whether the specified filename is a directory.
Note:
The result of this function is cached. Use
clearstatcache()
to clear the cache.
Syntax
is_dir(
file
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
file
Required. Specifies the path to the file to check
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE if the directory exists, FALSE otherwise
PHP Version:
4.0+

+1
